> Hi Pete,
> I have just looked at yo=
ur kozuka, this is not suri-hegashi gilding 
but uttori-zogan that has worn=
 through showing the typical 'holes' in 
the inlay (or more properly 'overl=
ay'), the last fruit is only just 
showing the wear, some leaves are worn a=
lso, uttori zogan would not 
have a hole in the top. The kozuka looks like =
16th century Mino Goto, 
The early Goto did not use suri-hegashi gilding.
>=
 Alan
